content.description: Several climate models for the original study area predict that the length of time the ground is covered in snow will decrease over time while the daylight periods will remain unchanged.
content.question: Assuming that the researchersâ€™ hypothesis about the timing of molting and the climate models are correct, which of the following will be the most likely immediate effect of the decrease in time the ground is snow covered on the hare population?

choices.label: The hare population will stop molting and maintain a single coat all year.
The hare population will migrate to an area with an even shorter time during which the ground is snow covered.
Hares will experience longer times with coat colors that do not blend with the ground color.
The process of molting from a white to a brown coat in hares will take longer.

content.answer: Hares will experience longer times with coat colors that do not blend with the ground color.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
